title.narrative: Boosting Research for Health in the New Arab World: A High Level Regional Conference
Conférence régionale de haut niveau en vue de stimuler la recherche en santé dans le nouveau monde arabe

description.narrative:
Political changes continue to sweep the Arab world, with demands for inclusion, democracy, equity, and better health and social services. These changes provide a unique opportunity to position research for health, particularly health policy and systems research, as the anchor upon which national health systems can be improved and strengthened. Research is needed to provide the scientific knowledge base for addressing demands for accountability, equity, and better health, health systems, and social services. Failure to take this opportunity risks diminishing some of the region's recent gains.
Most modern Arab countries have not prioritized research, science, and innovation as drivers for human and economic development. As a result, research for health in the Arab world has been lagging behind other regions. Its weaknesses exist in three broad areas: -weak national health research systems; -low levels of investment in health research; and, -weak research productivity.
This research support project will begin to address these health policy and systems research gaps. The region needs improved, well-structured, coordinated, and sustainable national health systems research to promote and support strong, equitable, and effective health systems.
This project will provide funding to the Council on Health Research for Development to begin to address these gaps through a high-level meeting where participants will explore how to strengthen research, science, and innovation for health in the region based on existing opportunities. It is expected to result in: -a call for action to strengthen system capacity for research and innovation for health; -a communication strategy to disseminate the call for action; and, -preparatory work for a regional conference.
High-level representatives from the Arab region and other key stakeholders will develop concrete actions to address the current gaps in health systems research in the region.
